Top-3 Similar Questions: au_225173: Help with creating bootable usb from iso

Top-3 Scripts: au_225173: dd if=imagefile.iso of=/dev/sdc oflag=direct bs=1048576

ul_278181: dd if=/path_to_iso_without_space.iso of=/dev/sdx
sync

dd bs=4M if=/path_to_iso.iso of=/dev/sdx

dd if=/path_to_iso_without_space.iso of=/dev/sdb

ul_574168: losetup -P /dev/loop0 /nfs/sda.raw  #this will create /dev/loop0p1 and loop0p2
dd if=/nfs/sda2.raw of=/dev/loop0p2
losetup -d /dev/loop0

dd if=/dev/sda of=/nfs/head.raw bs=512 count=2048
dd if=/dev/sda of=/nfs/tail.raw bs=512 skip=500117504
cat /nfs/head.raw /nfs/sda1.raw /nfs/sda2.raw /nfs/tail.raw > /nfs/sda.raw

Top-3 Similar Questions: au_147653: How to create a new iso image from an existing iso image?
ul_198141: How to rebuild ISO removing file from its mounted image?
au_28052: How do I create a video DVD from vob files?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_198141: -m glob
          Exclude files matching glob, a shell wildcard pattern, from being written to CD-ROM.  glob may match either the filename component or the full pathname.  This option may be used multiple times.  For example:

               genisoimage -o rom -m '*.o' -m core -m foobar

          would exclude all files ending in `.o', or called core or foobar from the image.  Note that if you had a directory called foobar, it too (and of course all its descendants) would be excluded.

   -exclude-list file
          A file containing a list of shell wildcards to be excluded.  See -m.

ul_87183: truncate -s64M file # no need to fill it with zeros, just make it sparse
fdisk file # create partitions
losetup /dev/loop0 file
mkfs.vfat /dev/loop0p1 # for the first partition.
mount /dev/loop0p1 /mnt/
